# fisdata

fisdata makes it easy to download data from the [FIS
webpage](https://www.fis-ski.com) into tibbles. It provides a variety of
functions to query different types of data like athletes, events, or
race results.

## Installation

You can install the development version of fisdata from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("stibu81/fisdata")
```

## Available Querying Functions

fisdata offers the following functions to query different types of data:

- [`query_athletes()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_athletes.md):
  query athletes by name and other attributes and obtain a table of
  matching athletes.
- [`query_results()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_results.md):
  query all competition results for a single athlete.
- [`query_race()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_race.md):
  get the full results for a single competition.
- [`query_events()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_events.md):
  query events by date, place, and other attributes.
- [`query_competitions()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_competitions.md):
  obtain all individual competitions that are associated with an event.
- [`query_standings()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_standings.md):
  get the cup standings with ranks and points per discipline.

All these functions are cached, that is, if they are called multiple
times in the same session, the data is downloaded only once. This leads
to better performance and reduces the number of requests that are sent
to the FIS webpage.

## Example Queries

Use
[`query_athletes()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_athletes.md)
and
[`query_results()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_results.md)
to get Didier Cuche’s full downhill results:

``` r
library(fisdata)
library(dplyr)

query_athletes("cuche", "didier") %>% 
  query_results(discipline = "DH") %>% 
  select(athlete:place, category:rank, cup_points)
#> # A tibble: 303 × 8
#>    athlete      date         age place      category discipline  rank cup_points
#>    <chr>        <date>     <dbl> <chr>      <chr>    <chr>      <int>      <dbl>
#>  1 Cuche Didier 2012-03-14    37 Schladming World C… Downhill      17         NA
#>  2 Cuche Didier 2012-03-13    37 Schladming Training Downhill       1         NA
#>  3 Cuche Didier 2012-03-03    37 Kvitfjell  World C… Downhill      10         26
#>  4 Cuche Didier 2012-03-01    37 Kvitfjell  Training Downhill       2         NA
#>  5 Cuche Didier 2012-02-29    37 Kvitfjell  Training Downhill       3         NA
#>  6 Cuche Didier 2012-02-11    37 Sochi      World C… Downhill      12         22
#>  7 Cuche Didier 2012-02-10    37 Sochi      Training Downhill       7         NA
#>  8 Cuche Didier 2012-02-08    37 Sochi      Training Downhill       2         NA
#>  9 Cuche Didier 2012-02-04    37 Chamonix   World C… Downhill       7         36
#> 10 Cuche Didier 2012-02-03    37 Chamonix   World C… Downhill       3         60
#> # ℹ 293 more rows
```

Use
[`query_events()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_events.md),
[`query_competitions()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_competitions.md)
and
[`query_race()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_race.md)
to get the full results of the Wengen Downhill in 2025:

``` r
query_events(sector = "AL", place = "wengen", season = 2025) %>% 
  query_competitions() %>% 
  filter(competition == "Downhill") %>% 
  query_race() %>% 
  select(rank, bib, name:diff_time)
#> # A tibble: 48 × 8
#>     rank   bib name              brand     birth_year nation time      diff_time
#>    <int> <int> <chr>             <chr>          <int> <chr>  <Period>  <Period> 
#>  1     1    13 Odermatt Marco    Stoeckli        1997 SUI    2M 22.58S 0S       
#>  2     2    12 Von Allmen Franjo Head            2001 SUI    2M 22.95S 0.37S    
#>  3     3     1 Hrobat Miha       Atomic          1995 SLO    2M 23.15S 0.57S    
#>  4     4     6 Paris Dominik     Nordica         1989 ITA    2M 23.27S 0.69S    
#>  5     5     7 Alexander Cameron Rossignol       1997 CAN    2M 23.29S 0.71S    
#>  6     6    14 Bennett Bryce     Fischer         1992 USA    2M 23.41S 0.83S    
#>  7     7     9 Murisier Justin   Head            1992 SUI    2M 23.76S 1.18S    
#>  8     8    37 Roesti Lars       Stoeckli        1998 SUI    2M 23.85S 1.27S    
#>  9     9    16 Crawford James    Head            1997 CAN    2M 23.86S 1.28S    
#> 10    10     3 Schieder Florian  Atomic          1995 ITA    2M 23.95S 1.37S    
#> # ℹ 38 more rows
```

Use
[`query_standings()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_standings.md)
to get the overall and downhill standings of the men’s alpine skiing
world cup in the season 2022/23:

``` r
query_standings(sector = "AL", season = 2023,
                category = "WC", gender = "M") %>% 
  select(athlete, nation, all_rank:dh_points)
#> # A tibble: 160 × 6
#>    athlete                 nation all_rank all_points dh_rank dh_points
#>    <chr>                   <chr>     <int>      <int>   <int>     <int>
#>  1 Odermatt Marco          SUI           1       2042       3       462
#>  2 Kilde Aleksander Aamodt NOR           2       1340       1       760
#>  3 Kristoffersen Henrik    NOR           3       1154      NA        NA
#>  4 Braathen Lucas          NOR           4        954      NA        NA
#>  5 Kriechmayr Vincent      AUT           5        953       2       614
#>  6 Meillard Loic           SUI           6        877      NA        NA
#>  7 Schwarz Marco           AUT           7        863      31        64
#>  8 Pinturault Alexis       FRA           8        839      NA        NA
#>  9 Feller Manuel           AUT           9        546      NA        NA
#> 10 Zenhaeusern Ramon       SUI          10        467      NA        NA
#> # ℹ 150 more rows
```

## Visualisation

fisdata also offers functions that can be used to visualise athlete
results. The following plot shows the number of World Cup podiums per
discipline for multiple athletes:

``` r
bind_rows(
    query_athletes("cuche", "didier") %>%
      query_results(category = "WC"),
    query_athletes("odermatt", "marco") %>% 
      query_results(category = "WC"),
    query_athletes("feuz", "beat") %>% 
      query_results(category = "WC"),
  ) %>% 
  plot_rank_summary(by = "discipline", interactive = FALSE)
```

![](reference/figures/README-fig-podiums-by-discipline-1.png)

## Learn more

- Get started with
  [`vignette("fisdata")`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/articles/fisdata.md)
  which can also be found
  [here](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/articles/fisdata.html).

- Browse the full
  [reference](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/) for
  functions and datasets.

# Package index

## Query

Functions that download data from the FIS page

- [`query_athletes()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_athletes.md)
  : Query Athletes
- [`query_results()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_results.md)
  : Query Results for an Athlete
- [`query_events()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_events.md)
  [`query_current_events()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_events.md)
  : Query Events
- [`query_competitions()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_competitions.md)
  : Query Competitions
- [`query_standings()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_standings.md)
  : Query Cup Standings for a Season or an Athlete
- [`query_race()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/query_race.md)
  : Query Race
- [`get_debuts()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/get_debuts.md)
  : Get the debut races, podiums or victories for an athlete
- [`get_athlete_image()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/get_athlete_image.md)
  : Get an Image of an Athlete
- [`play_athlete_name()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/play_athlete_name.md)
  : Play Athlete's Name in Browser

## Analyse

Functions to analyse query results

- [`summarise_results()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/summarise_results.md)
  : Summarise athlete's results

## Visualise

Functions to visualise query results

- [`plot_rank_summary()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/plot_results.md)
  [`plot_results_summary()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/plot_results.md)
  : Plot summary of one or more athlete's results
- [`plot_ranks_over_time()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/plot_results_over_time.md)
  [`plot_results_over_time()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/plot_results_over_time.md)
  : Plot athlete's results over time

## Other Functions

- [`show_url()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/show_url.md)
  [`browse_url()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/show_url.md)
  : Show or Browse URL Associated With a Query
- [`set_fisdata_defaults()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/set_fisdata_defaults.md)
  [`get_fisdata_defaults()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/set_fisdata_defaults.md)
  [`reset_fisdata_defaults()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/set_fisdata_defaults.md)
  [`fd_def()`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/set_fisdata_defaults.md)
  : Get And Set Default Values for Parameters in Querying Functions

## Datasets

Datasets describing values that can be used in the querying functions

- [`sectors`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/sectors.md) :
  Table of Codes for Sectors
- [`categories`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/categories.md)
  : Table of Codes for Categories
- [`disciplines`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/disciplines.md)
  : Table of Codes for Disciplines
- [`nations`](https://stibu81.github.io/fisdata/reference/nations.md) :
  Table of IOC Country Codes
